apps¶

text from apps/__init__.py

app¶

This module provides an interface for an App.

class App(args)¶

Bases: object

An abstract class representing the format of all Apps.

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the application.

abstract validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.

Does NOT affect actual execution behaviour

abstract run(inp, out)¶

Executes the application on the given arguments.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque filled with the results of application

execution.

Return type

deque

app_factory¶

Module for creating applications.

class AppFactory¶

Bases: object

A class used to create app objects

apps = {'cat': <class 'apps.cat.CatApp'>, 'cd': <class 'apps.cd.CdApp'>, 'cut': <class 'apps.cut.CutApp'>, 'echo': <class 'apps.echo.EchoApp'>, 'find': <class 'apps.find.FindApp'>, 'grep': <class 'apps.grep.GrepApp'>, 'head': <class 'apps.head.HeadApp'>, 'ls': <class 'apps.ls.LsApp'>, 'pwd': <class 'apps.pwd.PwdApp'>, 'sort': <class 'apps.sort.SortApp'>, 'tail': <class 'apps.tail.TailApp'>, 'uniq': <class 'apps.uniq.UniqApp'>}¶

A dictionary that maps app names to their classes

Type

(dict)

no_glob = {'find'}¶

A set of apps that don’t require globbing

Type

set

static get_app(app_str: str, opts: list) → apps.app.App¶

Returns an app object based on the app_str given.

Parameters

  • app_str (str) – A string that represents the command to be called. If app_str starts with ‘_’ the app will be treated as unsafe

  • opts (list) – A List of arguments that should be passed to the app.

Returns

An app object that is ready to be run

Return type

App

Raises

AppNotFoundError – If an app that doesn’t exist is requested for.

cat¶

Module representing the cat application: Usage in shell: cat [FILES]…

Example

cat bee-movie-script.txt

class CatApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the cat command line instruction

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the cat instruction

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the cat command on the given arguments.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

Each value of this deque will be a single line from the input file or piped data.

Return type

deque

validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.

Does NOT affect actual execution behaviour

cd¶

Module representing the cd application Usage in shell: cd PATH

Example

cd foo/bar/baz

class CdApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the cd shell instruction

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the cd command on the given arguments.

If no arguments are given, the current directory is changed to the users HOME directory. If not the users current working directory is changed to the directory given. This path can be relative or absolute.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects. In context of this specific application, it does not support piping and will therefore be ignored.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

Since the cd application does not return anything,

output will be unaltered.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If the path supplied is not a directory.

validate_args()¶

Check that the number of arguments is greater than 1 and if the given path exists.

Raises

ContextError – If more than one argument is supplied or the path given does not exist.

cut¶

Module representing the cut application Usage in shell: cut -b [RANGES] [FILES]…

Example

cut -b 0-23 rick-roll.txt

class CutApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the cut shell instruction

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the cut command on the given arguments.

Removes the bytes not specified in the -b option. If no arguments are given then the bytes are taken from stdin.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain the contents of the file,

seperated by line after removing bytes.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If the intervals specified by the -b option are invalid. Or the paths specified do not exist.

validate_args()¶

Ensures the options are valid.

Raises

AppRunException – If -b option is missing.

echo¶

This module represents the echo bash command. Usage in shell: echo [ARGS]…

Example

echo hello world

class EchoApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the echo shell command

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the echo command on the given arguments.

Simply appends the space seperated arguments supplied.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain the input arguments,

each seperated by whitespace.

Return type

deque

validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given arguments are valid.

find¶

Module representing the find application Usage in shell: find -name [PATTERN] [PATH]

Example

find -name *.py project/spaghetti-code

class FindApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the find shell instruction

Parameters

  • args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options

  • instruction (of the) –

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the find command on the given path.

Will match all files with the pattern supplied in the name option. If no path is supplied the current directory is used.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The output deque will contain each of the files that matched the specified pattern

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If the root path supplied does not exist.

validate_args()¶

Ensures that the -name option is present and only one argument is given

Raises

ContextError – If more than one argument is given or the -name option is missing.

grep¶

Module representing the grep application Usage in shell: grep [PATTERN] [FILE]*

Example

grep BARRY! bee-movie.txt

class GrepApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the grep shell intstruction

Parameters

  • args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options

  • instruction (of the) –

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the grep command on the given arguments.

Reads the specified files and returns all lines that match a specified regex pattern. If no files are given, stdin is grepped instead.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain the lines of the files,

which match the pattern supplied.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If the path specified does not exist/is not a valid file.

validate_args()¶

Ensures that arguments are supplied to the application.

Raises

ContextError – If no arguments are supplied.

head¶

Module representing the head application Usage in shell: head [OPTIONS] [FILE]

Example

head -n 12 text.txt

class HeadApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the head shell application

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the head command on the given arguments.

Returns the first few lines of a file. The amount is specified by the -n option. If this option is not supplied it is defaulted to 10.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain the first few lines of the file.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If any of the paths specified do not exist.

validate_args()¶

No args need to be checked for this application.

ls¶

Module representing the ls application Usage in shell: ls [PATH]

Example

ls super/secret/directory

class LsApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the ls shell instruction

Lists all files and directory in the specified directories. If none is given, lists the files and directories in the current directory.

Parameters

  • args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the

  • instruction. –

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the ls command on the given argument.

Lists all files/directories in a specified directory. If none is given, lists the files/directories in the current directory.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

Contains all of the files in the specified and current directory.

Return type

deque

Raises

ContextError – If the path supplied is not a directory.

validate_args()¶

Ensures at most one valid path is given.

Raises

ContextError if too many paths are given. –

pwd¶

Module representing the pwd application Usage in shell: pwd

Example

pwd

class PwdApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the pwd shell instruction

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction, which should be empty.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the pwd command.

Prints the path to the current working directory from root.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects. In context of this specific application, it does not support piping and will therefore be ignored.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

Will contain the current working directory.

Return type

deque

validate_args()¶

Ensures that no arguments are passed to the application.

Raises

ContextError – If any argument is passed to the application.

sort¶

Module representing the sort application Usage in shell: sort [OPTIONS] [FILE]

Example

sort my-life.txt

class SortApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the sort shell instruction.

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the sort command on the given arguments.

Sorts the contents of a file/stdin line by line and prints the result to stdout. If the -r option is present then the result is reversed. If no file is supplied, sorts the text supplied by stdin.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

Contains the file, sorted by line.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If the path supplied is not a directory.

validate_args()¶

Ensures that the correct amount of arguments are supplied.

Raises

ContextError – If too many arguments are given.

tail¶

Module representing the tail application Usage in shell: tail [OPTIONS] [FILE]

Example

tail [OPTIONS] [FILES]

class TailApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the tail shell command

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the tail command on the given arguments.

Returns the last few lines of a file. The amount is specified by the -n option. If this option is not supplied it is defaulted to 10.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain the last few lines of the file.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If any of the paths specified do not exist.

validate_args()¶

No args need to be checked for this application.

uniq¶

Module representing the uniq application Usage in shell: uniq [OPTIONS] [FILE]..

Example

uniq -i test-ans.txt

class UniqApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Class representing the uniq shell application

Parameters

args (list) – Contains all the arguments and options of the instruction

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the uniq command on the given arguments.

Parameters

  • inp (deque, optional) – The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

  • out (deque) – The output deque, used to store the result of execution.

Returns

The deque will contain all lines of the file that are

identical to the previous line in the file.

Return type

deque

Raises

RunError – If any of the paths specified do not exist.

validate_args()¶

No args need to be checked for this application

unsafe¶

Module representing the unsafe application decorator. Usage in shell: _application [OPTIONS] [ARGS]

Example

_head file-that-does-not-exist.txt

class UnsafeApp(app)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

A class representing the unsafe shell application decorator

Parameters

app (App) – The application be decorated.

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the application supplied.

If the application causes some error, instead of raising said error, the error message is added to the output deque, otherwise the output is added to the deque like normal.

validate_args()¶

No validation needed for an unsafe application
